Any hints for this?

issue.title: Error "Unable to locate package ros-melodic-ros1-ign" during build of docker image

content.raw:
There is file named 

[http://packages.ros.org/ros/ubuntu/pool/main/r/ros-melodic-mav-msgs/ros-melodic-mav-msgs\_3.3.2-0bionic.20190601.010407\_amd64.deb](http://packages.ros.org/ros/ubuntu/pool/main/r/ros-melodic-mav-msgs/ros-melodic-mav-msgs_3.3.2-0bionic.20190601.010407_amd64.deb)

available on the server, but not the requested file 

[http://packages.ros.org/ros/ubuntu/pool/main/r/ros-melodic-mav-msgs/ros-melodic-mav-msgs\_3.3.2-0bionic.20190320.023009\_amd64.deb](http://packages.ros.org/ros/ubuntu/pool/main/r/ros-melodic-mav-msgs/ros-melodic-mav-msgs_3.3.2-0bionic.20190320.023009_amd64.deb)

which seems to be an older version.  

Can I use the newer version? And how?
content.html:
There is file named

http://packages.ros.org/ros/ubuntu/pool/main/r/ros-melodic-mav-msgs/ros-melodic-mav-msgs_3.3.2-0bionic.20190601.010407_amd64.deb

available on the server, but not the requested file

http://packages.ros.org/ros/ubuntu/pool/main/r/ros-melodic-mav-msgs/ros-melodic-mav-msgs_3.3.2-0bionic.20190320.023009_amd64.deb

which seems to be an older version.

Can I use the newer version? And how?

issue.title: Error "Unable to locate package ros-melodic-ros1-ign" during build of docker image

content.raw:
I wonder if `apt-get update` needs to run again. Can you try adding `--no-cache` to `docker build` in `build.sh`? So it'll become ```docker build  --no-cache --rm -t $image_plus_tag --build-arg user_id=$user_id "$@" $DIR/$image_name
```
content.html: I wonder if apt-get update needs to run again. Can you try adding --no-cache to docker build in build.sh? So it'll become docker build --no-cache --rm -t $image_plus_tag --build-arg user_id=$user_id "$@" $DIR/$image_name

issue.title: Error "Unable to locate package ros-melodic-ros1-ign" during build of docker image

content.raw:
Thank you very much. It took some time \(started it yesterday, was finished this morning\), but it worked. All 62 Steps were processed and I now can start the docker container.

Is the cache updated with this command or do I have to manually delete the cache to avoid problems in the future?
content.html:
Thank you very much. It took some time (started it yesterday, was finished this morning), but it worked. All 62 Steps were processed and I now can start the docker container.

issue.title: Error "Unable to locate package ros-melodic-ros1-ign" during build of docker image
Error "Unable to locate package ros-melodic-ros1-ign" during build of docker image

content.raw:
Glad it worked!

> Is the cache updated with this command or do I have to manually delete the cache to avoid problems in the future?

I'm not entirely sure and I couldn't find a clear answer at https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/build/ but you shouldn't have to rebuild the docker image unless something changes in Dockerfile.
content.html:
Glad it worked!

Is the cache updated with this command or do I have to manually delete the cache to avoid problems in the future?

I'm not entirely sure and I couldn't find a clear answer at https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/build/ but you shouldn't have to rebuild the docker image unless something changes in Dockerfile.

issue.title: Error "Unable to locate package ros-melodic-ros1-ign" during build of docker image
Error "Unable to locate package ros-melodic-ros1-ign" during build of docker image

content.raw:
I’m still a beginner with docker, but I found an article that might explain the basis problem: [http://lenguyenthedat.com/docker-cache/](http://lenguyenthedat.com/docker-cache/)

The apt-get update and the apt-get install in the dockerfile for installing the “ros-melodic-ros1-ign” package is not combined in one command:

`...`

``RUN sudo /bin/sh -c 'echo "deb [trusted=yes] http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-stable `lsb_release -cs` main" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/gazebo-stable.list' \``  
` && sudo /bin/sh -c 'wget http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo.key -O - | sudo apt-key add -' \`  
` && sudo /bin/sh -c 'apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 --recv-key C1CF6E31E6BADE8868B172B4F42ED6FBAB17C654' \`  
` && sudo apt-get update`  
  
`# install ign-blueprint`  
`RUN sudo apt-get install -y \`  
`    ignition-blueprint \`  
` && sudo apt-get clean`  
  
`# install the ros to ign bridge`  
`RUN sudo apt-get install -y \`  
`    ros-melodic-ros1-ign \`  
` && sudo apt-get clean`

`...`  

This might be the reason for the problem I had.
content.html:
I’m still a beginner with docker, but I found an article that might explain the basis problem: http://lenguyenthedat.com/docker-cache/

The apt-get update and the apt-get install in the dockerfile for installing the “ros-melodic-ros1-ign” package is not combined in one command:

...

RUN sudo /bin/sh -c 'echo "deb [trusted=yes] http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-stable `lsb_release -cs` main" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/gazebo-stable.list' \
&& sudo /bin/sh -c 'wget http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo.key -O - | sudo apt-key add -' \
&& sudo /bin/sh -c 'apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 --recv-key C1CF6E31E6BADE8868B172B4F42ED6FBAB17C654' \
&& sudo apt-get update

# install ign-blueprint
RUN sudo apt-get install -y \
ignition-blueprint \
&& sudo apt-get clean

# install the ros to ign bridge
RUN sudo apt-get install -y \
ros-melodic-ros1-ign \
&& sudo apt-get clean

...

This might be the reason for the problem I had.

issue.title: Error "Unable to locate package ros-melodic-ros1-ign" during build of docker image

content.raw: Just FYI, I followed the docker install instructions today and had the same issue because the --no-cache was not yet added to the build.bash file that your wiki has us pull. Adding that did fix the issue for me as well. Not sure if it’s the wiki that’s out of date or if the docker directory has not been fully updated to reflect some of the issues being tracked here.
content.html: Just FYI, I followed the docker install instructions today and had the same issue because the --no-cache was not yet added to the build.bash file that your wiki has us pull. Adding that did fix the issue for me as well. Not sure if it’s the wiki that’s out of date or if the docker directory has not been fully updated to reflect some of the issues being tracked here.
